title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 524.4 - Supervising attorney
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 524.4 - Supervising attorney

State Regulations

For purposes of section
524.3, a supervising attorney must
be an attorney duly admitted to practice in the State of New York for a period
of at least three years and who is in good standing of the bar of the State of

New York. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
524.4

Adopted

New

York State Register July 22, 2020/Volume XLII, Issue 29, eff. 7/22/2020

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
